content.text: Milk Processing consists of transferring raw milk into high quality dairy products which have extended shelf life, are safe to consume and comply with (inter)national standards. Not only the dairy tec To add value to raw milk processing technologies will be applied to come to marketable, consumable, delicious and healthy dairy products. Techniques of preservation, quality control analyses, marketing and organisation will be trained. Product groups are: pasteurised milk, fermented milk, yoghurts, butter and ghee, different types of cheeses (fresh to semi-hard), ice cream and sweet porridges. For a sustainable milk processing business investments in a plant with equipment are inescapable, but running it profitable decisions need to be made regularly based on correct financial calculations, risk management, organisation and communication.

products.title: Dairy farm management, economics and housing of dairy cattle

content.text: xx xx

products.title: Breeding, reproduction management, AI and PD (pregnancy diagnosis)

content.text: Selection of the best animals on a dairy farm to breed better animals which will perform better under specific circumstances is an essential part in the management of every dairy farm worldwide Dairy farmers must be able to select the right breed of cows which fit their circumstances and their management style the best. After this choice has been made a dairy farmer should be able to determine which breeding policy to apply; selection of the best cows within his/ her herd and breeding bulls using the right selection criteria, using latest technologies (cross breeding, genomic selection, use of sexed semen, etc.). Once breeding policy has been determined animals have to be monitored for heat signs, choices have to be made on optimum insemination time, etc. Also in this process new technologies are coming up very fast/ management insights have changed during the last years. Once the cow has been inseminated it should be monitored and it should be checked for pregnancy. For pregnancy diagnosis new technologies are coming up fast which will help the farmer a lot in monitoring his herd and fertility management. This will require a lot of herd administration which will result in the calculation of key fertility performance indicators which need interpretation, analysis and action.

products.title: Dairy cattle nutrition, forage production and conservation

content.text: Optimal fodder production, incl. storage and preservation, in combination with optimum dairy cattle nutrition management in order to achieve maximum technical and financial performance on dairy farms Feeding management on commercial dairy farms is linked, besides milk production levels, with milk quality, condition and health of animals and their fertility status. Also young stock rearing systems determine to a large extend the quality of the dairy cow on the farm. Feeding costs usually make up often over fifty % of the variable costs on a commercial dairy farm. That is why production of good quality and enough quantity of roughage in combination with proper feeding management is the foundation for optimal technical and financial results on commercial dairy farms all over the world. During this course participants will learn how to optimize their fodder production, storage and conservation, feeding of dairy cattle and young stock rearing management taking into consideration as much as possible the conditions in which the participants have to work at home. Attention will also be given to calculation and interpretation of fodder production and feeding management performance indicators in order to monitor fodder production and feeding management including greenhouse gas emissions.

Developing competencies required for managing a commercial dairy farm. It comprises of 3 modules focusing on forage production, nutrition, breeding, reproduction management, housing and farm economics The objective of all commercial dairy farmers is to make a profit. The costs and quantities of inputs in combination with the technical results achieved and the output (milk) prices determine whether a dairy farm is commercially viable and therefore sustainable. Ensuring the production of sufficient quantity and quality of roughages, their preservation and usage in feeding dairy animals are essential. Fodder and feed is supplied according to requirements and used in the optimum way. Breeding and reproduction management are important in order to produce replacement animals of better quality. Getting insight with regard to housing and mechanisation of dairy farms which have their impact on labour efficiency, costs, animal welfare, environment. To monitor and evaluate the technical performance recording and analysis of all farm data will be important in order to make informed decisions. All of the above aspects also have their impact on technical and the financial performance of the dairy farm. As an entrepreneur you are also continuously looking for ideas to improve the technical and financial performance of your farm. This will require preparing business plans

For professionals engaged in feed processing and closely related fields Target Participant is able to: Formulate and produce properly processed compound feedws with the desired nutrient level Develop a plan for the production of compound feed for the situation back home, including the set up of a mill, equiping it, planning the production, formulating the range of feeds to be produced and an estimation of the required investment

Formulate and produce properly processed compound feeds with the desired nutrient level Develop a plan for the production of compound feed for the situation back home, including the set up of a mill, equipping it, planning the production, formulating the range of feeds to be produced and an estimation of the required investment

For managers in the field of pig production, for extension officers, teachers and instructors on pig production Taking care of farmhouses and working environment; orienting on market possibilities and developments; make a well motivated improvement plan

The participant is able to train/advise managers/workers on the management and day to day operation of parent stock, poultry breeding and a hatchery

For extension officers, teachers and instructors in animal production and for managers in the field of pig husbandry Taking care of animals; handling of primary livestock products; taking care of farmhouses and working environment; assessing results; making an improvement plan

Propose and plan methods to improve the genetic make up of a pig husbandry herd; practice in the selection of new breeding stock; execute artificial insemination on farm level, including semen collection and semen processing; assess the right moment of insemination

For extension workers, researchers, agricultural policy makers and teachers with the need to identify and exchange information and skills with their target groups Developing a training programme; carrying out a training program; evaluate a training programme; transferring knowledge and skills; organising extension and training activities; making a well motivated plan

For managers in the field of pig production, extension officers, teachers and instructors on pig production Orienting on market possibilities and developments; making a business plan; organising work; dealing with farm staff
The participant is able to compile a business plan in order to start or develop a pig farm/business

Learn to assess challenges and prospects in poultry management, learn about common issues in poultry management and compile a sound business plan to overcome challenges and benefit from prospects. Poultry development inevitably leads to market-oriented enterprises. These enterprises aim to maximise income which can be achieved by technical and economical efficient production. Analysis of the achieved results is important in order to recognise where improvements can be made and whether or not certain investments will be feasible. A proper business plan should be available. Health problems can seriously affect the profitability of the enterprise, so much attention is paid for preventive health programmes. Efficient production in itself is no guarantee for success of an enterprise. There should be a certain number of potential consumers with enough purchasing power willing to buy the products (marketing plan).

For extension officers, teachers and instructors in animal production and managers in the field of poultry husbandry Taking care of animals, handling of primary livestock products, taking care of farmhouses and working environment, assessing results

For extension officers, teachers and instructors in animal production and managers in the field of pig husbandry Taking care of animals; handling of primary livestock; taking care of farmhouses and working environment; assessing results

products.title: International diploma poultry husbandry and animal feed

content.text: For extension officers, teachers and instructors in animal production and for managers in the field of the husbandry of poultry and compound feed production Target: Manage, supervise or guide a poultry farm, appreciate local poultry farmers and create awareness of sustainable production concepts and methods

products.title: International diploma pig husbandry and animal feed

content.text: For extension officers, teachers and instructors in animal production and managers in the field of pig husbandry Target: - Manage or supervise or guid pig production from backyard systems to intensive, intermediate scale pig farming methods - Appreciate the relevance of local pig farmers' knowledge, experience and practices and create awareness of sustainable production concepts and methods -Identify, recognise and analyse opportunities and problems, taking into account constraints and utilise possibilities concerning pig husbandry

As a result of the training the participant is able to:  Manage or supervise or guide pig production from back-yard systems to intensive, intermediate scale pig farming methods.  Appreciate the relevance of local poultry farmers knowledge, experience and practices and create awareness of sustainable production concepts and methods.  Identify, recognise and analyse opportunities and problems, taking into account constraints and utilise possibilities concerning pig husbandry and the use of loc As a result of the training the participant is able to:  Manage or supervise or guide pig production from back-yard systems to intensive, intermediate scale pig farming methods.  Appreciate the relevance of local poultry farmers knowledge, experience and practices and create awareness of sustainable production concepts and methods.  Identify, recognise and analyse opportunities and problems, taking into account constraints and utilise possibilities concerning pig husbandry and the use of local feed-stuffs.  Co-operate with others of various disciplines in planning, designing and implementing projects in the field of pig husbandry and animal feed production.  Transfer relevant knowledge, skills and technology concepts to small and intermediate scale pig farmers and for animal feed producing units.  Tackle more efficiently the problems with regard to optimum utilisation of locall

As a result of the training the participant is able to:  Manage, supervise or guide poultry production from semi scavenging systems to intensive, intermediate scale poultry farming methods.  App Compulsory modules, including theoretical and practical subjects related to:  Farm management economics and marketing aspects.  Genetics and breeding.  Health, hygiene and pathology.  Housing and equipment.  Management topics.  Nutrition.  Eggs and hatching process.  Applied management in the PTC+ farm facilities.  Compilation of several reports and a back home improvement plan.  Linked to these topics participants develop required competences to return as a confident professional, implementing the PTC+ experience. Optional modules (in order to qualify for the Diploma the optional modules should add up to 480 study-load hours):  Poultry farming as an enterprise.  Poultry Breeding Management and Incubation.  Poultry Production Technology.  Organic farming (see page 37).  Sustainable manure utilisation.  Training and extension.  Product quality & food safety.  Feedstuffs & feed formulation.  Project Development.  Other species.

For extension officers, teachers and instructors in animal production and managers in the field of Pig Husbandry Targets: - manage, supervise or guide a pig production - appreciate the relevance of local pig farmers' knowledge, experience and practices and create awareness of sustainable production concepts and methods
